text: 875 North Michigan Avenue is a skyscraper in Chicago, United States. It was formerly known as the John Hancock Center. It is 344 meters (1,127 feet) tall and has 100 floors, including an observation deck on the 94th floor (1,000 ft). It was built in 1969 and is one of the tallest buildings in the world. ==Name change== On February 12, 2018, John Hancock Insurance requested that its name and logos throughout the building's interior be removed immediately; John Hancock had not had a naming-rights deal with the skyscraper's owners since 2013. Until a new naming-rights deal is finalized, the skyscraper will be known as "875 North Michigan Avenue".http://www.chicagotribune.com/business/columnists/ct-biz-john-hancock- center-name-ryan-ori-20180212-story.html "John Hancock Center skyscraper losing its iconic name". Chicago Tribune, 12 February 2018. ==Features== From the 95th-floor restaurant, diners can look out at Chicago and Lake Michigan. It has an observatory floor known as 360 Chicago. 360 Chicago is home to TILT, a moving platform that leans visitors over the edge of the skyscraper to a 30-degree angle. It also has a full bar, and Chicago's only open-air Sky Walk, and also has free interactive high-definition touchscreens in six languages. The 44th-floor sky lobby features the highest indoor swimming pool in the United States. On its 44th floor, the building has a grocery store accessible only to apartment residents and office tenants. == Photo Gallery == Image:Chicago 2007-7.jpg Image:John Hancock Center 031130.jpg Image:Hancock from Navy Pier.jpg Image:HancockCenterBraces.JPG Image:Sears tower fg03.jpg ==Related pages== * List of tallest buildings in Chicago * List of tallest buildings in the world == References == == Other websites == * The Hancock Observatory * Emporis.com - Aon Center * SkycraperPage.com â€“ Aon Center Category:Skyscrapers in Chicago Category:1969 establishments in Illinois
title: 875 North Michigan Avenue
